wikipedia_page.main: Margaret Pollock McPhun (1876–1960) was a British suffragette from Glasgow who served two months in Holloway Prison in London and composed a poem about imprisoned activist Janie Allan.

response: * Frances McPhun (1880–1940) –  suffragette who served two months in Holloway prison, sister of Margaret McPhun
* Margaret McPhun (1876–1960) – suffragette who served two months in Holloway prison, sister of Frances McPhun
